name: Blue Mechanostrider
description: "The terradynamic exo-plotters are conjoined by hydraulic imaging to the equilibrium enhancers..." -Binjy Featherwhistle

name: White War Talbuk
description: Despite their docile nature, talbuks have been known to gore seasoned warriors to death when threatened.

name: Brown Horse
description: A favorite among Stormwind's guards thanks to its patience and stamina.

name: Goblin Turbo-Trike
description: The turbo trike's tri-wheel design adds superior stability and a smaller turn radius over its two wheeled cousins.

name: Goblin Trike
description: A compilation of nuts, bolts, gears, and treated wood paneling make for an unusually smooth ride.

name: Bronze Drake
description: Lost time is never found again. Oh, never mind I found it. -Chronormu

name: Azure Drake
description: Always speak politely to an enraged dragon.

name: X-53 Touring Rocket
description: Riding a giant cylinder filled with highly explosive goblin rocket fuel all by yourself is just crazy...so bring a friend.

name: Black Nightsaber
description: Considered one of Azeroth's perfect predators, these agile beasts can sprint through dense forests without making a sound.

name: Ultramarine Qiraji Battle Tank
description: The Tol'vir sorcerer Azj'Aqir was said to possess a scepter that would allow him to control a Qiraj battle tank outside of its Silithus home.

name: Sandstone Drake
description: Sandstone Drakes were studied in great detail long ago by the famed alchemist Walleye Sprysprocket. It has even been said that Walleye developed potions to mimic the drakes' physiology.

name: Golden King
description: Don't let the saddle fool you, he's wild, not a tame lion.

name: Green Mechanostrider
description: "The terradynamic exo-plotters are conjoined by hydraulic imaging to the equilibrium enhancers..." -Binjy Featherwhistle

name: Springfur Alpaca
description: The kind nature of alpacas makes them perfect as companions for the intrepid adventurer.

name: Fossilized Raptor
description: Legends tell of a spell placed upon a hunting raptor who dared to snarl at young Tyrande Whisperwind as she bathed in a jungle pool. The beast is cursed to wander Azeroth -  until it apologizes.

name: Spectral Steed
description: Dark spirits flee before the radiance of its presence.

name: Dark Phoenix
description: Despite their name, Dark Phoenixes are known to have a warm and cheerful disposition.

name: Life-Binder's Handmaiden
description: Alexstrasza, the former dragon Aspect of Life, is known to be a kind and patient mentor. Under her tutelage, only the most dedicated pupils acquire the title of "Life-Binder's Handmaiden."

name: Great Red Dragon Turtle
description: "Packaged upgrades include; dual-lantern fog lights, emergency brew keg, and genuine Tanji leather seat."  - Turtlemaster Odai

name: White Mechanostrider Mod B
description: Forced to recall the model after numerous complaints of an "uncontrollable throttle", Gnomish engineers now refer to a proto-type blunder as a "model B".

name: Red Proto-Drake
description: The vrykul were the first to recognize their potential. Or maybe the second, depending on how you look at it.

name: Spectral Wolf
description: Fears only fire.

name: Rusted Proto-Drake
description: Not as shiny as the other one, but it's still a great find lads. Brann Bronzebeard

name: Grand Ice Mammoth
description: At home on the narrow, icy trails of the Storm Peaks, these mammoths are the only mounts the ice giants trust to carry large loads and multiple riders.

name: Turbostrider
description: The mirror's not so you can look back, but so your foes can see something besides your tailpipes. -Rillie Spindlenut

name: Swift Violet Ram
description: The Barak Tor'ol ram's thick bony skull and massive horns make it the ideal mount for charging through groups of armored enemies.

name: Black War Bear
description: Killing leaders of the Horde is its own reward, but this intimidating beast is an excellent memento.

name: Black War Bear
description: This formidable mount is bought with the blood of Alliance leaders, but you would have killed them for free.

name: Great Blue Elekk
description: An alpha member of the herd, this elekk is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through Northern Nagrand.

name: Tan Riding Talbuk
description: The orcs once hunted these graceful herd animals as part of the om'riggor rite of passage ceremony.

name: Grand Ice Mammoth
description: Due to high winds and avalanches, the Sons of Hodir recommend bringing at least two companions if venturing into the dangerous Storm Peaks.

name: Ironforge Ram
description: Wildhammer Fact Checker claims that this specific breed was the first type of ram domesticated by the dwarves when they settled in Dun Morogh.

name: Darkspear Raptor
description: This raptor breed was originally cultivated by the Drakkari, but has since been adopted by the Darkspear tribe in Northrend.

name: Swift Green Wind Rider
description: I still don't get why they fly faster when you put armor on them. -Drakma

name: Malevolent Drone
description: The Aqir drones feast on heroes and cowards alike to grow their ranks.

name: Black Proto-Drake
description: Bred specifically to honor those heroes who showed exceptional resilience and fortitude facing the dangers in Northrend.

name: Blue Skeletal Warhorse
description: A rare sight. Most disappeared once Baron Rivendare ruled in Stratholme.

name: Armored Siege Kodo
description: Only the strongest and most fearless of kodos can be trained to become living siege weapons. Even the highest walls won't keep them out for long.

name: Blue Dragonhawk
description: Dragonhawks are among the deadliest known predators. They are able to spot prey from great distances, rush in, and rend with both talon and beak.

name: Grand Caravan Mammoth
description: Merchants trust only this thundering, mountainous steed to protect them when venturing down Azeroth's most dangerous trade routes.

name: White Kodo
description: "The kodo is the backbone of our people. Wherever the Horde goes - in trade, settlement, or war - there you will find the mighty kodo." - Harb Clawhoof

name: Blue Proto-Drake
description: The Storm Peaks! There we will find the beast strong enough to bear me into battle. -Skadi the Ruthless

name: Red Dragonhawk
description: Dragonhawks are among the deadliest known predators. They are able to spot prey from great distances, rush in, and rend with both talon and beak.

name: Armored Blue Wind Rider
description: They are not native to Northrend, but they have adapted extremely well to the cold. -Mei Francis

name: Green Proto-Drake
description: The vrykul were the first to recognize their potential. Or maybe the second, depending on how you look at it.

name: Gnomeregan Mechanostrider
description: When you absolutely, positively have to be there right now. -Rillie Spindlenut

name: Darnassian Nightsaber
description: When a night elf's mount perishes, it is custom for the rider to keep one of the saber's great fangs as a token of remembrance.

name: Time-Lost Proto-Drake
description: The only reason for time is so that everything doesn't happen at once.

name: Magnificent Flying Carpet
description: Standard features include a sturdy imbued frostweave frame and real iceweb spider silk threading.  Spare head pillow sold separately.

name: Grand Caravan Mammoth
description: A common sight on trade routes all across Azeroth, this calm, stalwart mount is the favorite of merchants traveling to exotic and distant markets.

name: Illidari Doomhawk
description: Once a year, a rift in time appears, and strange things occur. The Illidari scouts and Doomwalker were quite surprised to find themselves in Tanaris.

name: Traveler's Tundra Mammoth
description: Ancient manuscripts depict merchants traveling across the frozen tundra with these colossal beasts, leading scholars to believe they are the first domesticated mounts.

name: Orgrimmar Wolf
description: For a brief time, many orcs would declare themselves "hungry like an Orgrimmar wolf." Some blood elves still use the phrase ironically.

name: Sky Golem
description: A glorious feat of engineering, the sky golem takes traditional shredder technology to a whole new level (and altitude!).

name: Blonde Riding Yak
description: Riding Yaks are bred to be slimmer and more agile than their kin.

name: Exodar Elekk
description: Exodar Elekk are elekk which have been anointed by O'ros, the Naaru who journeyed from Draenor to Azeroth with Velen and his followers.

name: Thunder Bluff Kodo
description: An alpha member of the herd, this kodo is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through Mulgore.

name: Traveler's Tundra Mammoth
description: Riders and merchants alike trust only this strong and steadfast mammoth to carry them safely across the frigid tundra.

name: Stormwind Steed
description: Although raised in Stormwind, this breed showed unusual aptitude for the cold weather in Icecrown.

name: Fiery Warhorse
description: Was one of the most vicious steeds stabled in Karazhan.

name: Great Purple Elekk
description: An alpha member of the herd, this elekk is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through Northern Nagrand.

name: Flying Carpet
description: Hop aboard this flying carpet to see the shining, shimmering, and splendid world of Azeroth, wonder by wonder.

name: Swift Nether Drake
description: The most aggressive nether drakes were awarded those heroes who showed significant prowess and commitment in the gladiatorial arena.

name: Forsaken Warhorse
description: When fallen heroes are raised into undeath, so too are their horses.

name: Silvermoon Hawkstrider
description: So I says I feel like chicken tonight. Next thing, I am flat out and that thing is trying to see what my eyes taste like. -Bozzle Blastbolt

name: Mimiron's Head
description: A token of titan craftsmanship hoarded by the Old God, Yogg-Saron. Currently the single largest mechanical gnome head in Azeroth.

name: Swift Moonsaber
description: Many night elves revere these proud mounts because their shimmering coats symbolize the goddess of the moon, Elune.

name: Swift Red Hawkstrider
description: What do you mean is it dyed? Oh, the bird. We did touch up the red just a little. -Trellis Morningsun

name: Argent Hippogryph
description: Argent Hippogryphs will partner with only the bravest and most battle-tested champions.

name: Cobalt Riding Talbuk
description: The orcs once hunted these graceful herd animals as part of the om'riggor rite of passage ceremony.

name: Striped Dawnsaber
description: Night elves once believed that seeing this light colored saber breed in the wild was an ill omen.

name: Swift Gray Steed
description: A veteran of some of the toughest battles fought by the Argent Crusade.

name: Dark Riding Talbuk
description: The orcs once hunted these graceful herd animals as part of the om'riggor rite of passage ceremony.

name: Ironbound Proto-Drake
description: His skin more hard than brass was found, that sword nor spear could pierce nor wound.

name: Great Golden Kodo
description: An alpha member of the herd, this kodo is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through the Southern Barrens.

name: X-45 Heartbreaker
description: Apothecary Hummel painted this masterpiece bright pink for an unrequited love.

name: Shadowbarb Drone
description: Void, jelly, and a very full belly is all this drone needs.

name: Wrathful Gladiator's Frost Wyrm
description: Many believe that during their early lives, these wyrms were forced to fight their own kind for the amusement of others. Perhaps that is why they possess a particularly combative temperament.

name: Argent Charger
description: Trained to accept only champions of the Light as a rider.

name: White Skeletal Warhorse
description: When fallen heroes are raised into undeath, so too are their horses.

name: Armored War-Bred Tauralus
description: The tauralus that serve the armies of Maldraxxus have had all traits of compassion bred out of them, and are only adorned in armor when they show that no sword or spell can stop them from carrying their rider to victory.

name: Wicked Swarmer
description: When the Void reached out, the Aqir were formed in its terrible image.

name: Bloodbathed Frostbrood Vanquisher
description: Bloodbathed Vanquishers are so named when it is determined that a reanimated frost wyrm died a particularly gruesome and bloody death.

name: Lightforged Ruinstrider
description: A loyal steed to the Lightforged Draenei.

name: Crimson Deathcharger
description: Stabled in the Icecrown Citadel to serve the Lich King's most favored minions.

name: Bronzewing Vespoid
description: Bronzewing vespoids are the result of attempting to synthesize a vespoid queen with no other members of a new hive. While no mortal has yet discovered how to synthesize a hive, the bronzewings are reliable mounts just as they are.

name: Grand Gryphon
description: Gryphons' keen eyesight allows them to see over vast distances and warn their riders of any dangers that lie ahead.

name: Venomhide Ravasaur
description: You raised this thing from a scaly pup - Mor'vek would be so proud. But he'd still make you clean up the mess it made in the corner.

name: Crimson Shardhide
description: When Korthia was pulled into The Maw, only a few hardy species survived.

name: Grand Wyvern
description: Wyverns hail from some of the most inhospitable regions of Kalimdor, making them masters of adapting to any environment.

name: Swift Purple Wind Rider
description: I still don't get why they fly faster when you put armor on them. -Drakma

name: Invincible
description: The famous steed of Arthas Menethil, who serves its master in life and in death.  Riding him is truly a feat of strength.

name: Swift Alliance Steed
description: A few of the Argent Crusade's swiftest mounts were awarded to those members of the Alliance who performed exceptionally during the tournament in Icecrown.

name: Relentless Gladiator's Frost Wyrm
description: In life, it could not be tamed, but necromancy and esoteric binding rituals have now combined to bend this indomitable creature to its rider's will.

name: Swift Burgundy Wolf
description: The wolves of the Horde are befriended, not domesticated.

name: Icebound Frostbrood Vanquisher
description: Raised from the chilling depths of Icecrown, Frostbrood Vanquishers are considered among the fiercest and most relentless of all frost wyrms.

name: Black Wolf
description: Can howl loudly enough to be heard for miles.

name: Magic Rooster
description: Magic in the hands of a genius can do wonderful, miraculous things. Magic in the hands of an idiot can make a giant rooster.

name: White Riding Talbuk
description: The orcs once hunted these graceful herd animals as part of the om'riggor rite of passage ceremony.

name: Exarch's Elekk
description: Draenei exarchs have long marched into war atop these imposing mounts, bred for their razor-sharp tusks.

name: Sea Turtle
description: Often caught by fishermen at a young age, these mounts are much more comfortable in the water than they are on land.

name: Hogrus, Swine of Good Fortune
description: Hogrus was first seen by Emperor Shaohao on the third day of his meditation, and is considered by the Pandaren to be a sign of good fortune to come to those who take action.

name: Argent Warhorse
description: Given only to those who prove themselves a champion in the Argent Tournament.

name: Grey Riding Yak
description: Riding Yaks are bred to be slimmer and more agile than their kin.

name: Lurid Bloodtusk
description: Only bloodtusks that survive the Contest of Conquest are deemed worthy enough to become a mount of the Undying Army.

name: Hand of Hrestimorak
description: The treachery of Hrestimorak was infamous, betraying his people to claim power. Facing damnation in the Maw, he tried to subvert the Jailer... a foolish act that would earn him an eternity of torment.

name: Tan War Talbuk
description: Despite their docile nature, talbuks have been known to gore seasoned warriors to death when threatened.

name: Pale Riding Crane
description: I looked, and behold, a pale... crane?

name: Black Drake
description: It never pays to leave a live dragon out of the equation.

name: Spawn of Horridon
description: When you see a hurricane coming, you get out of the way. Horridon would fight the hurricane and win.

name: Cobalt Primordial Direhorn
description: "When ya fight alongside raptors, ya want a mount dey can't eat." -Unknown dinomancer

name: Enchanted Shadeleaf Runestag
description: An shadeleaf runestag is capable of goring creatures as powerful as a gorm matriarch in defense of its herd. The Wild Hunt ride these mounts into dangerous corners of the Shadowlands, when their domain must be defended from those who would threaten the wilds.

name: Blue Riding Nether Ray
description: Nether Rays are among the most trusted, versatile mounts in all of Outland and beyond.

name: Infested Necroray
description: Necrorays lay their eggs in small clusters within the frills and hollows of decaying fungal blooms.

name: Obsidian Gravewing
description: In the darkened skies of Revendreth, you cannot see these creatures coming until it is too late.

name: Serenade
description: These beautiful helicids emerge only at night. When they are pleased, their shells hum with a joyful melody.

name: Machine Defense Unit 1-11
description: One of many such mechsuits designed to guard the Machine. After years of faithful service it is no longer suited for combat. It does make for an impressive conveyance, though.

name: Red Primal Raptor
description: Raptors have spread to nearly all of the lands of Azeroth. It is uncertain whether the trolls led them or followed them.

name: Obsidian Vorquin
description: Respected for their resilience in battle, even against dragonfire, these noble beasts are the prized mounts of the dracthyr cavalry.

name: Purple Hawkstrider
description: Some of our brethren prefer horses, but the hawkstrider will always be the true symbol of Silvermoon. -Winaestra

name: Great Brown Dragon Turtle
description: "Packaged upgrades include; dual-lantern fog lights, emergency brew keg, and genuine Tanji leather seat."  - Turtlemaster Odai

name: Horrid Dredwing
description: Harika the Horrid terrorized the denizens of the Forest Ward, and with her demise her broodlings can now take this horror to denizens farther afield.

name: Alabaster Thunderwing
description: Chiseled by the stoneworkers of Orgrimmar, this stone wind rider is a symbol of the unwavering strength of the Horde.

name: Jigglesworth Sr.
description: It's unclear how the saddle stays atop this formerly feline friend, but somehow the House of Plagues made it work. Science.

name: Eternal Phalynx of Purity
description: The armored phalynx is a favorite companion of the mightiest warriors of the Ascended as it is both fearless and vicious in battle.

name: Curious Crystalsniffer
description: Most vombata enjoy tunneling through the ground, but these sniffers seem to have an unerring ability to locate crystals buried deep underground and will congregate around large deposits.

name: Silver Covenant Hippogryph
description: Silver Covenant Hippogryphs are fiercely loyal, both to their riding partners, and to the Alliance.

name: Great Blue Dragon Turtle
description: "Packaged upgrades include; dual-lantern fog lights, emergency brew keg, and genuine Tanji leather seat."  - Turtlemaster Odai

name: Depthstalker
description: Poached from Zereth Mortis, a few of these jellyfish were lost when the poachers' ship sank. They found a new home in the Great Sea's depths.

name: Deadly Gladiator's Frost Wyrm
description: These reanimated vessels of destruction do not fear death; they dispense it.

name: Blazing Hippogryph
description: Hippogryphs are highly intelligent, sentient beings; far more than mere "mounts."

name: Twilight Drake
description: But the most important rule, the rule you can never forget, no matter how much he cries, no matter how much he begs, never feed him after midnight.

name: Frosty Flying Carpet
description: "I remember my first flying carpet... yeti hair and burlap.  Not nearly as nice as this one here." - Frozo the Renowned

name: Red Drake
description: You should never listen to minstrels' fancies. A dragon would never hurt a soul, unless they tried to hurt him first.

name: Hand of Salaranga
description: Salaranga was the most cunning of her kin and hid amongst the Beastwarrens. She struck at the Banished One with a horde of bestial allies. It did not matter.

name: Black Polar Bear
description: The taunka use black polar bear pelts in their religious rites, usually at the funerals of those who hunt black polar bears.

name: Skeletal Horse
description: Like most undead creatures, it did not choose its fate.

name: Elusive Quickhoof
description: The kind nature of alpacas makes them perfect as companions for the intrepid adventurer.

name: Qinsho's Eternal Hound
description: Qinsho wrought his eternal guardian from pure gold and imbued it with the resilience of the earth.

name: Rajani Warserpent
description: Fierce companions of the followers of Ra-den, the Rajani Warserpents are a force to be reckoned with.

name: Duskwing Ohuna
description: If you look to the night sky and see the clouds whisk by don't panic. It may just be the illusive Duskwing Ohuna.

name: Ruby Panther
description: Legends say that an ancient pandaren emperor crafted the first jeweled panther for his son after the boy's twin brother died of an illness.

name: Pale Acidmaw
description: The acid present in the ichor of this creature sapped away the color from its shell, leaving it a striking shade of snowy white.

name: Dreamlight Runestag
description: Runestags are granted to those who have pledged their service to the Winter Queen and the Court of Night.

name: Pandaren Kite
description: This token of honor is a gift from the Lorewalkers of Pandaria. Flying manual seemingly not included, however.

name: Vicious War Gorm
description: The gorm love eating the corpses of your enemies, so this seemed like a natural fit.

name: Phalynx of Purity
description: Little is known about the origination of phalynx technology, the machinations of which are taught more akin to religion than engineering.

name: Bonesewn Fleshroc
description: Only expert flesh-stitchers who have demonstrated mastery over the magics of Maldraxxus are powerful enough to construct a deathroc of this size.

name: Crypt Gargon
description: Loyal hounds of the Curator, these gargon patrol the crypts and catacombs deterring both trespassing and escape.

name: Ochre Dreamtalon
description: Playful dreamtalons often decorate themselves in a myriad of colors that only autumn offers.

name: Pearlescent Goblin Wave Shredder
description: Surf the shores of Stranglethorn in style!

name: Armored Red Dragonhawk
description: This rare breed of dragonhawk is a mark of honor in the Horde, gifted by the blood elves. It reflects your tireless effort to amass a small army of mounts.

name: Darkwarren Hardshell
description: The Darkwarren Hardshell's chitin is sturdy enough to withstand mortar shells and dragon's fire. It will also conveniently consume anything lacking anima, if needed.

name: Crusader's Black Warhorse
description: Awarded to only the most skilled champions from the Trial of the Crusader, these steeds were chosen for Horde members from Tirion Fordring's own personal stable.

name: Green Wind Rider
description: After being freed from vicious harpies by Cairne and Thrall, many of these creatures became valuable companions of the Horde.

name: Quel'dorei Steed
description: Comes from a lineage of fine horses that once grazed near the shores of the Well of Eternity.

name: Brown War Ottuk
description: The tuskarr of Iskaara are loathe to war against anyone, but many tuskarr and their allies have nonetheless taken up the spear with a war ottuk beside them.

name: Malevolent Gladiator's Cloud Serpent
description: These cloud serpents have scales that... are the color of clouds, actually.

name: Violet Netherwing Drake
description: After promising to fly you to the ends of Outland, the netherwing drake was eventually drawn to the blue skies of Azeroth as well.

name: Onyxian Drake
description: She has a lot in common with her mother, except for the being killed and reanimated. But she is young still. -Maloriak

name: Sunreaver Hawkstrider
description: I demand speed, grace and discipline on the battlefield. This one will serve nicely. -Eressea Dawnsinger

name: Thundering Cobalt Cloud Serpent
description: This is a descendant of the irascible Nalak. Lightning erupts from its scales and arcs over the saddle. Dare you sit?

name: Spectral Tiger
description: In true goblin fashion, Landro Longshot has put a stranglehold on the distribution of these mysterious incorporeal mounts.

name: Sunwalker Kodo
description: This magnificent beast, adorned in sacred charms and painted with holy imagery, radiates with the warmth of the sun.

name: Phalynx of Courage
description: A phalynx is considered both a worthy companion and a lithe opponent to test one's reflexes against.

name: Eternal Phalynx of Loyalty
description: A marvel of steward engineering, the armored phalynx is a rare and awe-inspiring sight.

name: Armored Bloodwing
description: This monstrous, flesh-eating bat is the undisputed ruler of the night skies.

name: Magic Rooster
description: Magic in the hands of a genius can do wonderful, miraculous things. Magic in the hands of an idiot can make a giant rooster.

name: Swift Spectral Tiger
description: Historians claim that these incorporeal beasts were created when Draenor exploded, unleashing energies that warped the world's flora and fauna.

name: Iskaara Trader's Ottuk
description: There are no guarantees when you purchase an ottuk from Tattukiaka. At least they're cute.

name: Marble Quilen
description: Created by a mogu sorcerer who breathed life into their favorite pet rock.

name: Talont
description: Some daydreams are filled with wondrous possibilities, but shatter when reminded of reality's limitations. Some dreams are not so burdened, even when they carry a rider.

name: Brawler's Burly Mushan Beast
description: For years pandaren believed these creatures to be untamable. Just ask the first pandaren to do so, Henshi "Limp Along" Homebrew.

name: Armored Blue Dragonhawk
description: After you amassed a massive menagerie of 200 mounts, the animal authorities of the Alliance sent you a means to keep them in line (and out of their hair).

name: Magic Rooster
description: Magic in the hands of a genius can do wonderful, miraculous things. Magic in the hands of an idiot can make a giant rooster.

name: Telix the Stormhorn
description: Once a simple beetle of the Forbidden Reach, Telix became infused with storm magic when Raszageth was unleashed. With its newly heightened senses, Telix roams the Dragon Isles alongside the Dragonscale Expedition--and you!

name: Cobalt Shalewing
description: Brood of Karoktra, raised in the underlight of Zaralek Cavern.

name: Majestic Armored Vorquin
description: Trained using ancient dracthyr methods, these armored vorquin are the pinnacle of tactical mounted ground warfare.

name: Ban-Lu, Grandmaster's Companion
description: The child of Xuen, Ban-Lu has served each Grandmaster faithfully for many years.

name: Verdant Gladiator's Slitherdrake
description: This drake visited many heroes in their dreams before joining your cause.

name: Creeping Carpet
description: Can't fly, but can creep very quickly.

name: Cenarion War Hippogryph
description: Members of the Cenarion Circle have shared a long and prosperous partnership with their hippogryph allies. When conflict is unavoidable, the Cenarion War Hippogryph is called into service.

name: Morning Flourish Dreamsaber
description: Known for the lavish energy that emanates from them, these sabers are notorious tricksters. Their roar scatters the early birds that wake them.

name: Kor'kron War Wolf
description: The Kor'kron use only the mightiest wolves for their mounts, bedecking them in armor that would break the backs of lesser creatures.

name: Amani War Bear
description: Only the swiftest heroes venturing into the troll temple of Zul'Aman were able to subdue these rare battle mounts.

name: Vicious War Mechanostrider
description: Equipped with head-mounted Critter Destroyer 9000.

name: Dashing Windsteed
description: Windsteeds are incredibly gentle and easy to train... if you can catch one.

name: Winding Slitherdrake
description: These drakes feel at home in the depths of the earth and the far reaches of the sky.

name: Kor'kron Juggernaut
description: The Kor'kron Juggernaut is a weapon of unbridled destruction, born from the mind of Garrosh Hellscream and made real by his engineers.

name: Black Skeletal Horse
description: The Forsaken believe that without a purpose, even beasts of burden suffer in undeath.

name: Great Red Elekk
description: Never seen in Nagrand, the first red elekk calves were born in Azeroth after the Exodar's arrival. Some breeders theorize that the unique coloration is somehow caused by the same radiation which ravaged Bloodmyst Isle.

name: Ironbound Wraithcharger
description: Its ethereal spirit is barely contained by its iron shell. The penultimate creation of Salanar the Horseman, these powerful steeds were once thought to have all been destroyed.

name: Big Slick in the City
description: Big heart, big dreams, Big Slick.

name: Calescent Shalewing
description: A shalewing born in the wake of Fyrakk's destructive breach. Cursed by his primal flame, its temperature slowly but constantly rises. It must immerse itself in water to cool off periodically, lest its own heat smother it.

name: Magic Rooster
description: Magic in the hands of a genius can do wonderful, miraculous things. Magic in the hands of an idiot can make a giant rooster.

name: Vicious Skeletal Warhorse
description: Only rewarded to those who have bested their foes in battle.

name: Huntmaster's Loyal Wolfhawk
description: The spirit of the Great Hunter found you worthy, and now its children will answer your call forevermore.

name: Colossal Umbrahide Mawrat
description: This disturbingly large Mawrat is an anomaly amongst its species. These Colossal Mawrats lurk only in the most distant and darkest reaches of Torghast.

name: Flarecore Infernal
description: The Legion has conquered thousands of other planets, devising fiendish alterations to their war machines when faced with extreme conditions.

name: Brewfest Ram
description: Brewers retired this mount from active advertising service after complaints that the beasts were "too temperamental" to control in major cities.

name: Leywoven Flying Carpet
description: The threads are so thin and well-stitched, you can't imagine it wasn't made by magic, strand by strand.

name: Furious Gladiator's Frost Wyrm
description: Some of Azeroth's mightiest dragons have been summoned across the veil between life and death to serve new masters with undying loyalty.

name: Spawn of Galakras
description: This formidable creature's lineage may be traced to Galakras, and yet further to Galakrond, one of the most infamous of all proto-dragons.

name: Turbo-Charged Flying Machine
description: Only the most talented engineers have the courage and the mental stamina to create a flying machine that boasts stability and safety.  Turbo-charging one is just crazy!

name: Golden Primal Direhorn
description: Sharp at both ends and crafty in the middle. Leave it to the trolls to think this was a good idea.

name: High Priest's Lightsworn Seeker
description: Once plentiful, only three seekers remain on Azeroth after generations of battling the corruption of the cosmos.

name: Zereth Overseer
description: Enigmatic and aloof, this construct of the First Ones flies on a graceful stream of perfect geometric understanding.

name: Igneous Shalewing
description: You'd be forgiven for mistaking this creature for a flying volcanic rock. Because to some extent, it is.

name: Swift Brewfest Ram
description: Dwarves attribute this breed's even temperament to rigorous training, but other races argue that a daily diet of strong ale has something to do with it.

name: Feathered Windsurfer
description: "Check the current windspeed and elevation before mounting. Avoid trees and other tall objects. Damaged kites are ineligible for return or refund." - Windsurfer's Instruction Manual

name: Ochre Skeletal Warhorse
description: When fallen heroes are raised into undeath, so too are their horses.

name: Colossal Ebonclaw Mawrat
description: This vicious and cunning creature has grown to its astonishing size by not only feasting upon the weakened souls in the Jailer's Tower, but also vulnerable Mawsworn.

name: Sapphire Riverbeast
description: This animal's color mimics the clear blue of Draenor's river shallows, making it almost invisible to aquatic predators.

name: Ashhide Mushan Beast
description: Some people say that riding an ashhide mushan will result in favorable health and increased prosperity. These people are called "mount vendors."

name: Vicious Kaldorei Warsaber
description: The blades adorning this mount's armor are designed to both inspire fear and pre-slice meals for the warsaber.

name: Deathlord's Vilebrood Vanquisher
description: A powerful red dragon raised in undeath by its own life energies, a true mockery of life.

name: Chauffeured Mekgineer's Chopper
description: Transportation is a precise business.

name: Darkwater Skate
description: Little is known about this elusive species of ray, found only in the dark waters surrounding Darkmoon Island.

name: Flying Machine
description: The backbone of the Alliance air force is comprised predominantly of gnomish flying machines due to their maneuverability and speed.

name: Thundering Onyx Cloud Serpent
description: This ebony cloud serpent is a lightning-wreathed vision of such rarity as to have driven many mortals to madness.

name: Battlelord's Bloodthirsty War Wyrm
description: Also responds to "Mister Bitey."

name: Gleaming Moonbeast
description: Armored in glistening silver, these devoted mounts are said to be a blessing from Elune herself.

name: Jeweled Copper Scarab
description: The rulers of desert kingdoms would attune crystals to their personal mounts for quick summoning.

name: Rocket Shredder 9001
description: The salesgoblin always tells people about the RS-9001's huge variety of attachments, but somehow neglects to mention that you never get to pick the attachments it'll have when you mount up.

name: Mudback Riverbeast
description: Special webbing that grows on the soles of the mudback's feet gives them extra traction in mud and slick terrain.

name: Tyrannical Gladiator's Cloud Serpent
description: These cloud serpents always look elegant and slim in classic black.

name: Merciless Nether Drake
description: The most aggressive nether drakes were awarded those heroes who showed significant prowess and commitment in the gladiatorial arena.

name: Merciless Nether Drake
description: The most aggressive nether drakes were awarded those heroes who showed significant prowess and commitment in the gladiatorial arena.

name: Crimson Primal Direhorn
description: Leave it to the blood elves to pick the red one.

name: Gold-Toed Albatross
description: Soaring from a distant timeway, this never-before-seen avian variant was born in a world of order.

name: Crimson Glimmerfur
description: Gilnean legend states this red-and-white fox only crosses the Winter Veil during one season.

name: Mosshide Riverwallow
description: Aggressive and territorial, the mosshide is known for hiding in river-shore scrub and ambushing unwary passersby.

name: Blacksteel Battleboar
description: Refuses to run unless its head is covered in heavy, spiked metal. It's an ego thing.

name: Grievous Gladiator's Cloud Serpent
description: These brilliantly colored cloud serpents have scales that are a mixture of ruby, gold, and nearly violet.

name: Huntmaster's Fierce Wolfhawk
description: A jumble of talons and claws that can fly and swim. No one is safe.

name: Hellfire Infernal
description: From the bowels of the nether is summoned a creature of pure hatred, bent on burning down any life in its way.

name: X-51 Nether-Rocket
description: First designed as a booster for a much larger rocket, the X-51 was determined to give the perfect thrust capacity for a single rider payload.

name: Prideful Gladiator's Cloud Serpent
description: These brilliantly colored cloud serpents have scales that range from gold to pink. Or we could call it coral.

name: Windborne Velocidrake
description: The long talons of the velocidrake give it an edge on the plains.

name: Swift Frostwolf
description: Amidst the cold heights of Frostfire, the frostwolves hunt anything they can catch. The fastest among them eat well.

name: Rocktusk Battleboar
description: It's not the metal helmet that attracts mates; it's the sweet mohawk.

name: Grey Riding Camel
description: Fennimore Quigley is credited with milking the first camel and breaking the record for "longest unintentional flight," all in the same afternoon.

name: Solar Spirehawk
description: Looking into the eyes of this mystical beast is like peering into the heart of the sun. Goggles are recommended when you're riding.

name: Taivan
description: You don't have to be what the world expects you to be. Be who Taivan knows you *can* be.

name: Warmongering Gladiator's Felblood Gronnling
description: One of the gronnlings of Tanaan Jungle caught in the eruption of fel energies unleashed by Gul'dan, and now beholden to an unquenchable lust for chaos.

name: Amber Pterrordax
description: The Pterrordax could and would eat you in seconds. Are you sure sitting on its back is a good idea?

name: X-51 Nether-Rocket X-TREME
description: What it lacks in safety features it more than makes up for in speed and style.  Not for the faint of heart.

name: Beledar's Spawn
description: Through the Sacred Flame, whispers of dark carry you to battle.

name: Charming Courier
description: Neither snow nor rain nor heat nor gloom of night stays these charming couriers from the swift completion of their appointed rounds.

name: Golden Discus
description: An ancient mogu artifact awarded to those who are deeply committed to forms of currency.

name: Armored Frostboar
description: Subsists almost entirely on a diet of frozen berries. Though it finds slow off-worlders equally tasty.

name: Swift Gray Ram
description: The Barak Tor'ol ram's thick bony skull and massive horns make it the ideal mount for charging through groups of armored enemies.

name: Smoky Direwolf
description: Believed to reside mostly in the north. Hates weddings.

name: Frostplains Battleboar
description: If it didn't have the cool tusk ring, it would feel so silly in that outfit.

name: Vermillion Imperial Lynx
description: Imperial lynxes are considered to be an Arathi's greatest companion, both on and off the battlefield. Sadly, this lynx's previous owner died in battle.

name: Grinning Reaver
description: The difference between a smile and a grin is the difference between a kiss and tasting.

name: Shadowmane Charger
description: Draenei poets have likened this talbuk's coloring to shadows cast by moonlight in an ashen forest.

name: Elusive Emerald Hawkstrider
description: Unseen for many years, this brightly hued hawkstrider emerged from hiding to help defend the Ghostlands from the Scourge. Its prowess shines as brilliantly as its feathers.

name: Tan Riding Camel
description: Fennimore Quigley is credited with milking the first camel and breaking the record for "longest unintentional flight," all in the same afternoon.

name: Armored Razorback
description: Never... ever... EVER... let it smell bacon on you.

name: Giant Coldsnout
description: Its snout is not just cold but wet. Not a pleasant way to wake up.

name: Illidari Felstalker
description: The Illidari have broken some lesser demons for use against their Legion masters.

name: Swift White Ram
description: The Barak Tor'ol ram's thick bony skull and massive horns make it the ideal mount for charging through groups of armored enemies.

name: Red Qiraji War Tank
description: The Qiraji War Tank has only been seen recently during the Call of the Scarab, could this hint at a resurfacing of the deadly creatures?

name: Dustmane Direwolf
description: Cautious by direwolf standards, the dustmane can only be coaxed to ride with something it considers special.

name: Loyal Magmammoth
description: Liberated from the Qalashi and harnessed by your ingenuity (and your harness), this magmammoth is ready to lava stomp wherever you want to go.

name: Vicious War Ram
description: Until it head-butts you below the belt, it has not truly accepted you as its rider.

name: Primal Gladiator's Felblood Gronnling
description: One of the gronnlings of Tanaan Jungle caught in the eruption of fel energies unleashed by Gul'dan, and now beholden to an unquenchable lust for chaos.

name: Highland Drake
description: The drakes of Azure Span follow a strict personal code of honor as they explore the isles anew.

name: Swift Breezestrider
description: Draenei have relied on this mount, the swiftest of all talbuk, to relay messengers and their missives safely to their destinations.

name: Stormtouched Bruffalon
description: Even from within her prison, Raszageth's primal scorn brought the mightiest beasts to heel.

name: Grove Warden
description: These magical companions are the wardens of peaceful, primordial groves within the Emerald Dream.

name: Emerald Hippogryph
description: These majestic animals come in various colorings, but the emerald variety can only be tamed by the magic of friendship.

name: Great White Kodo
description: A rare albino of the species first spotted in Desolace.  The centaur claim that a white kodo is a harbinger of doom.

name: Core Hound
description: Molten to the core!

name: Arctic Wolf
description: Once thought to be nearly extinct, this wolf can still occasionally be seen in the company of a few Horde veterans

name: Felcrystal Scorpion
description: The results of a fel infusion experiment with one of Skorpyron's offspring.

name: Dread Raven
description: Filled with the hatred of an ancient god, the dread raven are the Arakkoa's most trusted guardians.

name: Challenger's War Yeti
description: Thankfully they move fast and mostly leave the smell behind them.

name: Felstorm Dragon
description: The Burning Legion defeated dragons in a distant timeway. These foul fel wyrms chose corruption and servitude over destruction.

name: Breezestrider Stallion
description: These breezestriders' red coloration reflects their temperament: sanguine, fierce, and courageous.

name: Swift Orange Raptor
description: Longtime allies of the trolls, these jungle hunters form a special bond with their masters. They become mount, guardian, and friend.

name: Pale Thorngrazer
description: This talbuk subsists completely on a diet of thistles and thorns, making its insides as tough as its outside.

name: Corrupted Dreadwing
description: Bathed in the blood of demons, these corrupted Dread Ravens are significantly more aggressive, and will often kill one another if kept in confinement.

name: Warforged Nightmare
description: A nightmarish steed of hardened steel and vengeful spirits, this companion will follow you to the depths of the Firelands and back without complaint.

name: Cobalt War Talbuk
description: Despite their docile nature, talbuks have been known to gore seasoned warriors to death when threatened.

name: Domesticated Razorback
description: "Domesticated" does not mean "friendly." Bring some treats.

name: Sunhide Gronnling
description: Loves the sun, hates everything else.

name: Purple Skeletal Warhorse
description: When fallen heroes are raised into undeath, so too are their horses.

name: Champion's Treadblade
description: Forged by human, gnome, and dwarf, this armored masterpiece is designed to slice a tauren into a tri-tip dinner with a flick of the handlebars.

name: Windborne Velocidrake
description: The long talons of the velocidrake give it an edge on the plains.

name: Iron Skyreaver
description: Iron Horde beastmasters bred this rylak for war and then girded it for battle in black steel and smoldering flame.

name: Trained Silverpelt
description: Prized for its intelligence, this breed of talbuk can be trained to execute defensive kicks and gorings in battle.

name: Swift Blue Raptor
description: Longtime allies of the trolls, these jungle hunters form a special bond with their masters. They become steed, guardian, and friend.

name: Spirit of Eche'ro
description: The spirit of Huln Highmountain's pet moose.

name: Swift Olive Raptor
description: Longtime allies of the trolls, these jungle hunters form a special bond with their masters. They become mount, guardian, and friend.

name: Wild Goretusk
description: If you want a gentle ride, go find a "tame happytusk" or something.

name: Armadillo Roller
description: The technologies and creatures of the deep will help us traverse these unknown areas.

name: Great Greytusk
description: Sheds its tusks once a year. Is extremely shy until they grow back.

name: Vicious War Raptor
description: Because sharp teeth and claws weren't enough.

name: Great Gray Kodo
description: An alpha member of the herd, this kodo is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through Desolace.

name: Llothien Prowler
description: These sleek foxes can prowl amongst newly-fallen leaves without making a sound, even at this size.

name: Zovaal's Soul Eater
description: "Was I a good boy?" the soul asked Zovaal. "No. I'm told you were the worst."

name: Palomino
description: Human nobles have long favored this majestic breed for its beautiful golden coat and flowing white mane.

name: Grove Defiler
description: The Grove Wardens of the Emerald Dream were some of the first to fall to the corrupting influence of the Nightmare.

name: Island Thunderscale
description: One of the larger native dragon species on Azeroth, this subspecies subsists almost entirely on fish. And fishermen.

name: Garn Steelmaw
description: A trainer once tried to put decorative metal in his steelmaw wolf's mouth. He had to wait three days to get it back.

name: White Stallion
description: The powerful and unyielding white stallion features heavily in the myths of ancient human tribes.

name: Savage Blue Battle Turtle
description: Don't feel blue chasing your foes, you've got cannons. Nothing can outrun a cannon.

name: Garn Nighthowl
description: The garn are the most fierce predators on Draenor, and always hunt in packs.

name: Great Brown Kodo
description: An alpha member of the herd, this kodo is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through the Northern Barrens.

name: Mottled Red Raptor
description: Bred from the fiercest stock anywhere and guaranteed not to bite (much).

name: Mechacycle Model W
description: The rapid technological evolution of the descendants of Mimiron began with the introduction of a new gear, leading to such wonders as the tragically under-produced Model W.

name: Felsaber
description: A special creation of Lord Illidan gifted to his most trusted demon hunters.

name: Warsong Direfang
description: Has a will of iron but is a sweetheart if you give it a clefthoof bone to chew on.

name: Trained Icehoof
description: It wasn't until you owned this mount that you understood how much the world of Draenor would test you. Clefthoof hair gets in everything!

name: Swift Brown Wolf
description: The wolves of the Horde are befriended, not domesticated.

name: Beastlord's Warwolf
description: One of Darmac's trained beasts, it was raised in a crucible of molten fire and shows no fear.

name: Trained Rocktusk
description: Thoroughly trained in how to snort, trot, and stomp on the faces of its enemies.

name: Winterspring Frostsaber
description: Taming this savage breed requires patience, strength, and a large supply of fake mice and twine.

name: Tundra Icehoof
description: A translucent layer of down hair covers this breed's leathery hide, acting as the perfect insulation for cold environments.

name: Highland Mustang
description: A valiant steed on the Arathi Highlands, it knows no fear.

name: Unpainted Mechanostrider
description: "The terradynamic exo-plotters are conjoined by hydraulic imaging to the equilibrium enhancers..." -Binjy Featherwhistle

name: Headless Horseman's Mount
description: Be it into the flood, or into the fire, this one will go where you require.

name: Swift Stormsaber
description: Rumor has it that this breed was named after the renowned archdruid Malfurion Stormrage.

name: Icy Blue Mechanostrider Mod A
description: This historic piece of gnomish engineering was forced into retirement due to its extremely "touchy" gyroscometer.

name: Armored Frostwolf
description: It's trained to survive the harsh climate of Frostfire Ridge, so it snuggles as if its life depended on it.

name: Gorestrider Gronnling
description: Once "befriended", a gronnling will happily carry its rider to their death.

name: Ivory Raptor
description: Bred from the fiercest stock anywhere and guaranteed not to bite (much).

name: Frostwolf Howler
description: Raised in the Alterac Mountains by the Frostwolf Clan.

name: Swift Timber Wolf
description: The wolves of the Horde are befriended, not domesticated.

name: Trained Riverwallow
description: Riverwallows are one of the heartiest beasts on Draenor, resulting in their increased stamina and distinctive coloring.

name: Ironside Warwolf
description: It has an armored spike on its tail. Scratch its belly at your own risk.

name: Mechagon Peacekeeper
description: Keeps the peace by turning you into pieces.

name: Swift Gray Wolf
description: The wolves of the Horde are befriended, not domesticated.

name: Trained Snarler
description: Enormously cute as a puppy. Slightly less so now.

name: Mystic Runesaber
description: Infused with arcane power, the Mystic Runesaber has long been hidden by chaotic nether energies. Recently they have emerged from the shadows in search of ley lines to sate their thirst for magic.

name: Corrupted Fire Hawk
description: Millagazor was a fire hawk loyal to Ragnaros. At this time it is unknown how many of Millagazor's eggs were corrupted.

name: Green Mechanostrider
description: "The terradynamic exo-plotters are conjoined by hydraulic imaging to the equilibrium enhancers..." -Binjy Featherwhistle

name: Bloodhoof Bull
description: Members of the Warsong clan have long hunted these clefthoof to use their crimson-hued skin for battle standards.

name: Ironhoof Destroyer
description: Blackhand is said to have personally designed the fiery armaments used on the Iron Horde's clefthoof battle mounts.

name: Armored Razzashi Raptor
description: The purebred royal raptors of Zul'Gurub, these mounts have become a rare sight in Stranglethorn Vale. The Gurubashi have been known to fly into a rage at the sight of any non-troll riding one of their precious beasts.

name: Mottled Meadowstomper
description: The elekk's long trunk allows it to sniff out sources of food, avoid danger, and steal snacks from your bags when you're not looking.

name: Trained Meadowstomper
description: The draenei perfected elekk husbandry long ago, adorning the creatures with Light-infused crystals to make them more docile.

name: Black Ram
description: I've not seen this breed in in ages, but when they're ram tough they stick around. -Veron Amberstill

name: Wen Lo, the River's Edge
description: The rivers of Pandaria, like Wen Lo, are unpredictable in nature. They may remain calm, bringing water to the crops, or flood, bringing ruin. Wen Lo reminds us that we must adapt to the challenges of life.

name: Shadowhide Pearltusk
description: Some legends say the draenei first befriended the elekk after one of the beasts saved an injured scout from a pack of vicious podlings.

name: Snowfeather Hunter
description: Capable of hiding in a fog bank until prey approaches, then slicing them open with one claw-raised jump.

name: Frost Ram
description: I've not seen this breed in in ages, but when they're ram tough they stick around."" -Veron Amberstill"

name: Predatory Bloodgazer
description: The sheer amount of raw red berries these fierce omnivores consume gives them their distinctive eye color.

name: Brilliant Direbeak
description: The shimmering hides of these deceptively fierce and coordinated beasts are intended to confuse and disorient prey.

name: Dusty Rockhide
description: Ever since acquiring this mount, you have been plagued by strange fever dreams of hippety-hoppety clippety-cloppety elekk on parade.

name: Mottled Drake
description: I thought the thing was ill until it took to the air. It flies as true as any of my own. -Alexstrasza

name: Kor'kron Annihilator
description: Vicious in battle and surprisingly loyal, this battle scorpion serves only those who show true commitment to a powerful guild.

name: Steelbound Devourer
description: Only the sturdiest-forged chains can restrain this beast.

name: Viridian Sharptalon
description: Adept at blending into dense, magical forests, such as one may find around the Broken Isles.

name: Long-Forgotten Hippogryph
description: You are the only one that remembered.

name: Prestigious War Wolf
description: At Warchief Hellscream's command, Horde trainers began raising wolves to thrive in the shock and ferocity of sustained combat.

name: Red Skeletal Horse
description: The Forsaken believe that without a purpose, even beasts of burden suffer in undeath.

name: Mastercraft Gravewing
description: Handcrafted by the Stonewright herself, this mastefully crafted stoneborn is entrusted only to those she deems worthy.

name: Imperial Quilen
description: Favorite pets of the ancient Mogu princes, Quilen make loyal and fearless companions and mounts.

name: Ratstallion
description: Years of chain-chugging potions in Dalaran's sewer system have allowed him to grow large, agile, and shadow resistant.

name: Dreadsteed
description: WARNING: It craves only fel energy. Not apples. It hates the seeds.

name: Brinedeep Bottom-Feeder
description: These elusive fish prefer to skulk in the deepest reaches of the Great Sea, searching the darkness for food.

name: Cliffside Wylderdrake
description: Often roosting along the steep cliff faces of Thaldraszus, they're swift to the skies in times of danger.

name: Witherhide Cliffstomper
description: Tiny notches cover the hooves of this variation of clefthoof, allowing it to safely scale mountainous regions in search of food.

name: Swift Brown Steed
description: A veteran of some of the toughest battles fought by the Argent Crusade.

name: Modest Expedition Yak
description: Unlike its burden-bearing kin, this yak prefers to travel light and go no more than a mile at a time.

name: Gooey Snailemental
description: Formed from the leftover elemental energies of the Primal Storms, this magical mollusk is faster than it appears.

name: Netherlord's Chaotic Wrathsteed
description: A deadly combination of fel and horse.

name: Swift Palomino
description: Prized by horse breeders for their discipline and steadfastness.

name: Swift Brown Ram
description: The Barak Tor'ol ram's thick bony skull and massive horns make it the ideal mount for charging through groups of armored enemies.

name: Phosphorescent Stone Drake
description: The Stonemother has shown little concern for the rebellious Aeonaxx, even allowing his spawn to be taken from her realm.

name: Great Green Elekk
description: An alpha member of the herd, this elekk is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through Northern Nagrand.

name: Warhorse
description: Trained to stand firm in righteous combat.

name: Purple Elekk
description: Patient and strong, the Elekk exemplify the Draenei attitude towards the hardships of life.

name: Spotted Frostsaber
description: This hearty mount's ferocious appetite earned it the nickname "Dragon Belly" in the night elf language.

name: Striped Nightsaber
description: Considered one of Azeroth's perfect predators, these agile beasts can sprint through dense forests without making a sound.

name: Heart of the Aspects
description: You are Azeroth's true guardians and the future of this world is in your hands, for the dawning of the age of mortals has begun. - Alexstrasza

name: Cindermane Charger
description: Formed by Ragnaros himself as a gift for the daughter he never had.

name: White Riding Camel
description: Fennimore Quigley is credited with milking the first camel and breaking the record for "longest unintentional flight," all in the same afternoon.

name: Feldrake
description: Fighting the Burning Legion millennia ago, this valiant drake fell to corruption after its body was infused with raw demonic magic.

name: Ivory Raptor
description: Bred from the fiercest stock anywhere and guaranteed not to bite (much).

name: Corrupted Hippogryph
description: It is a sad fact that even the wise and majestic hippogryph may fall prey to corruption.

name: Turquoise Raptor
description: Bred from the fiercest stock anywhere and guaranteed not to bite (much).

name: Sunstone Panther
description: Legends say that an ancient pandaren emperor crafted the first jeweled panther for his son after the boy's twin brother died of an illness.

name: Jade Cloud Serpent
description: Jade Cloud Serpents are light and agile; quick and deadly.

name: Darkmoon Dancing Bear
description: These fearsome mounts have a habit of suddenly breaking out into dance amid battle, much to the annoyance of their riders.

name: Violet Raptor
description: Bred from the fiercest stock anywhere and guaranteed not to bite (much).

name: Black Qiraji War Tank
description: The Qiraji War Tank has only been seen recently during the Call of the Scarab, could this hint at a resurfacing of the deadly creatures?

name: Chauffeured Mechano-Hog
description: Why drive yourself around when you can hire someone to do it for you?

name: Xiwyllag ATV
description: It was said that this invention was modeled after the likeness of a very wealthy goblin. Although others don't really see the resemblance.

name: Obsidian Nightwing
description: When you can't run, you crawl, and when you can't crawl you find someone to carry you.

name: Mountain Horse
description: Images of this breed are often found on kegs of watered-down dwarven brew.

name: Subdued Seahorse
description: "One has not truly lived until they have felt the tidal current rushing through their hair while atop a majestic seahorse," said no one.  Ever.

name: Crimson Gladiator's Drake
description: Forged in the fires of conquest, and armored to the teeth.

name: Blue Drake
description: Come not between the dragon and his wrath.

name: Swift Red Gryphon
description: The Horde had dragons, we had the gryphons. We won that war. - Ilsa Blusterbrew

name: Sapphire Panther
description: Legends say that an ancient pandaren emperor crafted the first jeweled panther for his son after the boy's twin brother died of an illness.

name: Shadowblade's Lethal Omen
description: They'll never hear you coming.

name: Red Mechanostrider
description: "The terradynamic exo-plotters are conjoined by hydraulic imaging to the equilibrium enhancers..." -Binjy Featherwhistle

name: Wooly Mammoth
description: Directly descended from the original progenitor of the mammoth race, wooly mammoths are considered more feral and primal than their shorter-haired cousins.

name: Black War Mammoth
description: Sure-footed and unflappable, these dark-furred mammoths are prized for their steady temperament going into battle.

name: Tamed Skitterfly
description: It didn't take long for Granpap Whiskers to tame the skitterflies around the Dragonscale Basecamp and set them to helping move Expedition personnel and cargo.

name: Vicious War Steed
description: Armored to withstand collisions in battle.

name: Tyrael's Charger
description: A symbol of justice throughout all known realms.

name: Swift Green Gryphon
description: The Horde had dragons, we had the gryphons. We won that war. - Ilsa Blusterbrew

name: Jade Panther
description: Legends say that an ancient pandaren emperor crafted the first jeweled panther for his son after the boy's twin brother died of an illness.

name: Shadowblade's Baneful Omen
description: For the toxin-inclined.

name: Prestigious Bronze Courser
description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

name: Spectral Pterrorwing
description: Vengeful spectres abound in the spirit realm surrounding Dazar'alor.

name: Obsidian Gladiator's Slitherdrake
description: This mischievous drake enjoys flying through geysers and volcanic plumes.

name: Plagued Proto-Drake
description: Bred specifically to honor those heroes who showed significant courage and persistence facing the dangers in Northrend.

name: Swift Mountain Horse
description: Longs for the day it may return to its home in Gilneas.

name: Wooly Mammoth
description: This wild variant of the mammoth is not bred for riding. Most wooly mammoths are captured in the wild and tamed by their riders, resulting in a fierce, cunning mount.

name: Vicious War Wolf
description: At Warchief Hellscream's command, Horde trainers began raising wolves to thrive in the shock and ferocity of sustained combat.

name: Shadowblade's Crimson Omen
description: The blood of your enemies won't even show up, blends right in.

name: Thalassian Charger
description: Basking in the power of M'uru has strengthened its will.

name: Violet Proto-Drake
description: I cannot help but wonder if things would have turned out different if the titans had elevated even one more dragonflight. -Alexstrasza

name: Vicious Gladiator's Twilight Drake
description: Heroes who proved their might in the gladiatorial arenas during the Cataclysm were awarded the most exceptional of the twilight drake broods.

name: Prestigious Royal Courser
description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

name: Mekgineer's Chopper
description: Sporting superb engineering craftsmanship, this chopper is one of the few personal vehicles on Azeroth built for two.

name: Ice Mammoth
description: The Sons of Hodir believe that riding an ice-white mammoth will protect the rider from frostbite and snow blindness.

name: Flametalon of Alysrazor
description: As with their matriarch, Alysrazor, the fury and fervor of these elemental avians are unquenchable.

name: Spectral Gryphon
description: When you said an old friend was coming back, this was not quite what I expected. -Bralla Cloudwing

name: Winged Guardian
description: Unearthed recently in an ancient tomb, this mighty winged lion may have once served one of the ancient Tol'vir princes.

name: Armored Brown Bear
description: This ursine mount's swiftness is enhanced by its heavy armor, imbued with magic from Kirin Tor magi.

name: Grand Black War Mammoth
description: Once used by giants to carry heavily armored warriors, these grand war mammoths can easily bear more than one rider of less-than-giant stature.

name: Albino Drake
description: Even the Draconic Native Association tests proved inconclusive in determining if the albino drake is related to a known dragonflight. -Breanni

name: Ice Mammoth
description: Many ice giants claim that they have trained their favored white mammoths to trigger avalanches with their trumpeting calls.

name: Armored Snowy Gryphon
description: The nice thing is that when they attack, blood almost never stains their feathers. -Mei Francis

name: Grand Black War Mammoth
description: Rarely, a war mammoth is born stronger and more tractable than its peers. These mammoths are dubbed "grand" and carry more than one rider to the front lines.

name: Armored Brown Bear
description: Your cries of "For the Horde!" will be much more menacing from atop a heavily armored bear that's barreling down on Alliance at top speed.

name: Swift Shorestrider
description: A rarity amongst the tallstrider breeds of Kalimdor, but easily recognized by its pungent dead seaweed aroma.

name: Fathom Dweller
description: Deep within the hungering chasms of the Great Sea, swarms of Fathom Dwellers sway like a great floating carpet, sightlessly in the dark.

name: Frostbrood Proto-Wyrm
description: The same magic of undeath that raised the Frostbrood into the Lich King's service has infused this primal wyrm. Its loyalty and ferocity now serve those who defend Azeroth.

name: Sulfur Hound
description: The Black Empire subjugated these humbled and hateful hounds. Utterly obedient, they still serve the strong.

name: Valarjar Stormwing
description: The beating of its wings sound like the rolling of thunder in the distance.

name: Minion of Grumpus
description: No one quite knows when the legend of Grumpus began in Draenor, but his toys are just the worst.

name: Silver War Talbuk
description: Despite their docile nature, talbuks have been known to gore seasoned warriors to death when threatened.

name: Leyfeather Hippogryph
description: Ancient mounts of the Highborne, now left to run wild in the Broken Isles, they can rarely be found due to their latent magical powers.

name: Blazing Drake
description: Blazing Drakes exhibit a boundless passion for life, and are considered by many to be among the most loyal mounts on Azeroth.

name: Emerald Drake
description: "Is the emerald drake rare?  You have no idea.  If I had a silver for every time someone asked me about one, I could have retired years ago." -Mei Francis

name: Riddler's Mind-Worm
description: It feeds on your thoughts, even the ones you are thinking as you read this.

name: Dark War Talbuk
description: Despite their docile nature, talbuks have been known to gore seasoned warriors to death when threatened.

name: Demonic Gladiator's Storm Dragon
description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

name: Violet Spellwing
description: A gift from the Council of Six for saving Azeroth from the threat of the Legion once more.

name: Luminous Starseeker
description: Energetic apex hunters of Argus, the panthara hunt by sensing the energy within living things. A panthara approaching a powerful energy source will visibly change color and become more excited.

name: Scrappy Worldsnail
description: For the Worldbreakers, a portable footstool. For you, a hardy mount.

name: Dire Wolf
description: Once thought to be extinct except in the far north. Highly sought by those preparing for winter.

name: Squawks
description: Guess why he's called that? It's not because he's a nice, quiet pet.

name: Prestigious War Steed
description: Armored to withstand collisions in battle.

name: Gilded Ravasaur
description: A mount fit for Zandalari high priests and councilers, gilded with only the finest decoration and blessed by Rezan, the great devilsaur loa.

name: Bloodfang Widow
description: Its long, serrated limbs drip with the blood of its enemies and/or mate.

name: Pandaren Kite
description: This "mount," awarded by the Lorewalkers of Pandaria, is a reward to the hero of their organization.

name: Darkmoon Dirigible
description: Silas considered using his fleet of blimps for marketing, but decided that selling them directly was all the marketing he needed.

name: Azure Skitterfly
description: Once Granpap Whiskers finally taught them how to take riders, the azure skitterflies proved to bond closely and loyally to their riders.

name: Verdant Skitterfly
description: Verdant skitterflies are the perfect mount for the scouts of the Dragonscale Expedition scouts, as they are fast and blend into the foliage of the Dragon Isles.

name: Sable Ruinstrider
description: Talbuks, native to Argus, have evolved chitinous plates to survive the decades of ceaseless war that ravages the landscape.

name: Valiance
description: Most undead steeds have their riders chosen for them. Valiance, on the other hand, chooses its own rider.

name: Felsteel Annihilator
description: Forged deep within Hellfire Citadel by a mad blacksmith, the Felsteel Annihilator combines the metalworking knowledge of the Iron Horde with the chaotic fel energies of the Burning Legion into an unholy union of steel and flame.

name: Prestigious Azure Courser
description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

name: Amani Dragonhawk
description: Dragonhawks liberated from troll enslavement are considered among the most loyal of all their kin.

name: Ancient Frostsaber
description: The lack of spots or stripes marks this beast as a descendant of the most ancient frostsaber line.

name: Infinite Timereaver
description: Fickle and savage, these drakes slip in and out of time until they find a worthy rider.

name: Green Skeletal Warhorse
description: When fallen heroes are raised into undeath, so too are their horses.

name: Sharkbait
description: Sharkbait's loyalty lies with whomever keeps the crackers coming.

name: Coalfist Gronnling
description: This little gronnling is well-known for smashing his way into garrison inns and making a mess of the pots and pans.

name: Flameward Hippogryph
description: Flameward Hippogryphs revel in the defeat of Ragnaros, Lord of Fire.

name: Brown Skeletal Horse
description: The Forsaken believe that without a purpose, even beasts of burden suffer in undeath.

name: Royal Seafeather
description: The sharp beaks of these parrots are capable of breaking open large nuts with ease.

name: Prestigious Midnight Courser
description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

name: Vindictive Gladiator's Storm Dragon
description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

name: Dragon Isles Drake Model Test
description: NYI

name: Bestowed Trawling Mammoth
description: A gift from Scout Tomul, so that the feasts of Iskaara will always have enough fish to feed those in need.

name: Starcursed Voidstrider
description: This shadow-infused strider embodies the elves' commitment to harness the power of the Void in the name of the Alliance.

name: Vicious Warstrider
description: Exquisite, dignified and deadly.

name: Pureblood Fire Hawk
description: Legends state that the Pureblood line may be traced back to the very creation of the Firelands.

name: Rustbolt Resistor
description: "R E S I S T" is carved into the seat in crude letters, along with several, more profane things.

name: Wild Gladiator's Felblood Gronnling
description: One of the gronnlings of Tanaan Jungle caught in the eruption of fel energies unleashed by Gul'dan, and now beholden to an unquenchable lust for chaos.

name: Coral-Stalker Waveray
description: This species of ray seems to have evolved to stalk its prey amidst the brightly colored corals of the seas.

name: Beastlord's Irontusk
description: One of Darmac's trained beasts, its tusks can pierce even the hardest Iron Horde steel.

name: Huntmaster's Dire Wolfhawk
description: If asked to fetch, will most likely bring you back the head of a small mammal or humanoid.

name: Shadowflame Shalewing
description: Born from the magma, its carapace was originally molten blobs cooled to form dark-colored volcanic rock. Being imbued by shadowflame has only solidified its unbreakable nature.

name: Nether-Gorged Greatwyrm
description: Few mana wyrms find sufficiently stable sources of arcane power to reach such a size. A greatwyrm's appetite for mana is unmatched.

name: Felfire Hawk
description: Felfire is deadly to the touch.  Luckily, the hawk can suppress the flames, choosing not to incinerate its rider in an emerald effigy.

name: Netherlord's Brimstone Wrathsteed
description: The smell isn't particularly pleasant, and it REALLY stays with you.

name: Rivendare's Deathcharger
description: When Baron Rivendare became a champion of the Scourge, he condemned his favorite horse to join him in undeath.

name: Fearless Gladiator's Storm Dragon
description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

name: Temperamental Skyclaw
description: Slyverns are rarely comfortable acting as mounts. Only those willing to feed their gluttonous appetites and keep a careful eye on them should attempt to ride.

name: Highlord's Vengeful Charger
description: What's he so mad about?

name: Deathtusk Felboar
description: Veterans of the battle for Outland's Hellfire Peninsula are traumatized by thoughts of these beasts to this day.

name: Netherlord's Accursed Wrathsteed
description: Shadow plus fire, what could go wrong?

name: Bestowed Sandskimmer
description: A gift from Granpap Whiskers, these capricious skitterflies help the Timewalkers clean up present (and future) sand-related temporal calamities.

name: Beryl Ruinstrider
description: Talbuks, native to Argus, have evolved chitinous plates to survive the decades of ceaseless war that ravages the landscape.

name: Savage Raptor
description: One-time companion of Kanga the Primal, the fallen troll hero. The raptor's name is unknown, for Kanga only spoke to it in bear form.

name: Highlord's Vigilant Charger
description: His blank horse stare is "vigilance," actually.

name: Riding Kodo
description: "The kodo is the backbone of our people. Wherever the Horde goes - in trade, settlement, or war - there you will find the mighty kodo." - Harb Clawhoof

name: Soaring Skyterror
description: The extra-light equipment on this chromatic rylak allows it to swoop and glide through the clouds easily, free from the bounds of the land below.

name: Ancient Salamanther
description: Due to their preference for dark caves and murky waters, sightings of this unique breed of salamanther are so rare that many researchers thought they had gone extinct.

name: Leaping Veinseeker
description: Bug spray and a hat with netting aren't going to do much in the swamps of Nazmir, bring a club.

name: Gray Kodo
description: "The kodo is the backbone of our people. Wherever the Horde goes - in trade, settlement, or war - there you will find the mighty kodo." - Harb Clawhoof

name: Bristling Hellboar
description: The one and only source for the rare culinary ingredient: cursed bacon.

name: Ivory Hawkstrider
description:
"My winged children fill the skies. Not this one though."

-Aviana

name: Mossy Mammoth
description: Preserved for thousands of years in stone, bronze magic has nearly aged this mammoth back into a fossil.

name: Lizi, Thunderspine Tramper
description: Nothing will stop Lizi from her mission to eat all the world's fruit.

name: Drake of the West Wind
description: Harnessing the elemental powers of the storm, these majestic beasts crackle like lightning and roar like thunder.

name: Highlord's Valorous Charger
description: Has many valorous points.

name: Archmage's Prismatic Disc
description: Three elements have been fused to create this magical disc, which is attuned to your specific magical powers.

name: Brown Kodo
description: "The kodo is the backbone of our people. Wherever the Horde goes - in trade, settlement, or war - there you will find the mighty kodo." - Harb Clawhoof

name: Perfected Juggernaut
description: Perfection, like beauty, is in the eye of the beholder. But eyesight can be surgically enhanced.

name: Infernal Direwolf
description: A mighty wolf of Draenor, touched by the fel energies unleashed by Gul'dan in Tanaan Jungle. It has not gone completely mad... yet.

name: Prestigious Forest Courser
description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

name: Vicious War Elekk
description: A favorite of warriors of the Exodar.

name: Prestigious Ivory Courser
description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

name: Drake of the North Wind
description: They sicken of the calm who know the storm.

name: Grand Expedition Yak
description: These beasts of burden are known to carry over five times their own weight and to be capable of lasting several days without food or water.

name: Arcadian War Turtle
description: Bred for destruction by an insane warlord in a far-off land, but at least the seat is warm.

name: Eclipse Dragonhawk
description: Captured from the renegade blood elves at Eclipse Point, these purple dragonhawks were often sought after by Scryers posted to the Sanctum of the Stars.

name: Great Northern Elderhorn
description: One of the heartiest of species that inhabit the slopes of Highmountain, they can survive for months in freezing blizzards.

name: Coralscale Salamanther
description: As Raszageth's storms abated, this aquatic breed of salamanther was among the many wonders to settle among the shores in their wake.

name: Felglow Mana Ray
description: The Army of the Light could only save so many of Argus' native species; countless numbers were lost to chaos.

name: Vicious Gilnean Warhorse
description: Born, bred and battle tested in Gilneas.

name: Green Kodo
description: An alpha member of the herd, this kodo is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through Desolace.

name: Vicious War Kodo
description: The spiked ball on the tail is strong enough to crush through even the most reinforced Alliance defenses.

name: Cruel Gladiator's Storm Dragon
description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

name: Kafa Yak
description: It's unclear whether grummles named this yak after its color or purpose.

name: Swift Spectral Armored Gryphon
description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

name: Teal Kodo
description: "The kodo is the backbone of our people. Wherever the Horde goes - in trade, settlement, or war - there you will find the mighty kodo." - Harb Clawhoof

name: Umber Ruinstrider
description: Talbuks, native to Argus, have evolved chitinous plates to survive the decades of ceaseless war that ravages the landscape.

name: Scintillating Mana Ray
description: Some of the natural wildlife of Argus, like the mana ray, has survived and adapted to life on the shattered world.

name: Voidtalon of the Dark Star
description: Corrupted by the presence of the Dark Star in Draenor, the Voidtalons resisted being broken by the Shadowmoon Clan and were ultimately destroyed by Ner'zhul. Only a single egg remains, lost in the void.

name: Drake of the South Wind
description: Gentle as a summer breeze, but that says little considering where it came from. -Itesh

name: Ferocious Gladiator's Storm Dragon
description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

name: Plainswalker Bearer
description: The mammoths of the Ohn'ahran Plains are unaccustomed to carrying people, as their centaur neighbors do not typically ride mounts. They can learn to bear riders, however. Some even do so enthusiastically.

name: Azure Cloud Serpent
description: Azure Cloud Serpents are believed by the Pandaren to be harbingers of good fortune.

name: Swift Spectral Rylak
description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

name: Black War Steed
description: Trained to withstand brutal hand-to-hand combat in the fiercest battlefields.

name: Avenging Felcrusher
