description: Hold on a sec, Sarge isn't that large, someone must have spun a tall tale in the Hearthstone Tavern...

name: Dusklight Razorwing
description: Razorwings can be seen throughout Korthia, making their nests on high hills and in trees.

name: Bloodthirsty Dreadwing
description: The forsaken prefer the use of these bloodthirsty hunters, both for their speed as a mount, and the psychological effect they have on their enemies.

name: G.M.O.D.
description: Garishly sporting extreme amounts of goblin flair, Gallywix commissioned his Mech of Death to one up Mekkatorque in combat and more importantly in style.

name: Scarlet Pterrordax
description: This pterrordax was so eager to take to the skies that its handler couldn't finish training it.

name: Vengeance
description: Sylvanas lost a part of herself the day Arthas took her life, and the darkness within her grew to fill the void.

name: Felblaze Infernal
description: The Illidari were able to break one of these fiery beasts for use as an unstoppable, fearless mount against the Legion.

name: Sunwarmed Furline
description: The presence of the giant felines heralds the beginning of the end for the birds of Azeroth.

name: Swift Green Mechanostrider
description: We have made a lot of improvements, but they are still based on the Mekkatorque designs. -Milli Featherwhistle

name: Anu'relos, Flame's Guidance
description: Though her feathers flicker with flame's destructive potential, they do not scorch, but simply radiate a comfortable heat.

name: Azshari Bloatray
description: The naga raised these rays in captivity, harvesting their gas organs to craft alchemy which allowed them to breathe air more easily.

name: Silent Glider
description: Gasses naturally stored within the creature allowed it to survive within the depths, those same gasses also allow them to effortlessly float through the air.

name: Pale Regal Cervid
description: Looking at these majestic creatures, it's not difficult to see how the idea of cervids developed into the stags found on Azeroth and other mortal worlds.

name: Proudmoore Sea Scout
description: Only a few gryphons are selected to be Sea Scouts operating from flag ships in the fleet. Their long range reconnaissance is an integral part of Kul Tiran sea dominance.

name: Stormsong Coastwatcher
description: Tasked with keeping watch on the seas for approaching dangers, the Stormsong Coastwatchers fly constant patrols.

name: Highland Drake
description: The drakes of Azure Span follow a strict personal code of honor as they explore the isles anew.

name: Seething Slug
description: Drawn forth from its abyss by the rage of the Zaqali.

name: Highwind Darkmane
description: The Forsworn and their mounts take on a darker aspect upon renouncing the path laid forth by the Archon. While tame enough to ride, the Highwind Darkmane has a fiercely independent streak.

name: Russet Bufonid
description: Russet is a rare color among bufonids that is normally only seen on specimens that are tainted by other cosmic forces, or synthesized from a perplexing schematic that invokes that color.

name: Steamscale Incinerator
description: A mad gnomish inventor had a dream to ride a dragon, so he created this metal monstrosity. He powered it with a trapped demon, in order to create "an authentic dragon soul," and did not survive its activation.

name: Magmashell
description: Who's a good little new-forged snail made entirely of elemental lava? You are! Yes, you!

name: White War Wolf
description: Can a wolf's hunger ever be satiated? These lupine brutes seek and devour the enemies of the Horde.

name: Heartbond Lupine
description: From the moment of its creation, this packless lupine has held nothing more than deepest affection and loyalty towards you.

name: Hand of Bahmethra
description: The most wicked and cruel of her kin, Bahmethra endured the full measure of the Banished One's punishments before her fall.

name: Wandering Ancient
description: A staunch defender of the forests of Azeroth, the ancients are also known for their glorious canopies of leaves, which change color with the seasons.

name: Vicious Sabertooth
description: The elite Alliance forces that use these sabertooth mounts use a battle cry that translates from Darnassian as "here kitty kitty".

name: Jade, Bright Foreseer
description: The presence of this majestic Pandaren rabbit spirit brings joy and happiness and is heralded as a wonderful omen. Legend says that in its eyes, you can glimpse the greatest happiness of your life, even if it is yet to come.

name: Riverwalker Mushan
description: The Mushan is a voracious beast. Though it can be tamed, it will demand a second, third, and even fourth breakfast every day.

name: Tuskarr Shoreglider
description: The Tuskarr learned long ago that some of the bones of the sea creatures they hunted were light and buoyant, making for effective glider materials.

name: Amalgam of Rage
description: The fearsome beast ridden by Astaroth himself is now yours to command.

name: Wooly White Rhino
description: Captured by Toby "Mother Goose" Ironbolt on the Borean Tundra, this shaggy beast carries an enormous grudge after being bridled by a gnome.

name: Stargrazer
description: One can't help but think what it might feel like to pluck the stars from their fixture in the sky. Perhaps, Stargrazer will show us how someday.

name: Divine Kiss of Ohn'ahra
description: ...as though welcomed by the wind itself.

name: Ravenous Black Gryphon
description: War corrupted these once-proud creatures. The susurration of their wings now whispers omens of imminent demise.

name: Swift Spectral Drake
description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

name: Verdant Armoredon
description: The gnarled horns of this armoredon are far stronger than bone.

name: Auspicious Arborwyrm
description: Sprouting to life only once every sixty years, this living wooden dragon combines the patience of a tree and the grace of a dragon in flight.

name: Delugen
description: Imagine being so engrossed by a dream that it feels real; some might even call it a delusion.

name: Gilnean Prowler
description: A scrupulous breed of prowlers whose ferocity can only be matched by that of the worgen. These decisive creatures embody discipline and a controlled viciousness that even the worgen have come to admire.

name: Great Sunwalker Kodo
description: At daybreak, the noble Sunwalkers often perform rituals to bless their mounts, imbuing them with holy magic.

name: Enchanted Fey Dragon
description: This majestic creature is Brightwing's older brother. He affirms that she was, in fact, adopted.

name: Guardian Quilen
description: When Quan the Relentless fell in battle, his loyal hounds waited for his return. Millenia later, they remain patient.

name: Rose Riding Crane
description: This brightly-colored bird is often confused with a flamingo or marabou.

name: Gilded Riding Crane
description: It is said that an emperor once paid a large sum for a golden crane. Upon discovering that the crane was only colored like that of the precious metal, he hid with shame in his bedchambers for a week.

name: Silver Riding Crane
description: This tall bird is one of the most graceful and elegant cranes, slightly moreso than the Bronze Crane but less than the Golden Crane.

name: Luxurious Riding Crane
description: A majestic bird, but a rather picky eater.

name: Eve's Ghastly Rider
description: The preferred transportation of the Fenlow family (especially during Hallow's End).

name: Tropical Riding Crane
description: This Jade Forest native uses its coloration as camouflage.

name: Winter Night Dreamsaber
description: These nocturnal dreamsabers carry the chill of winter with them and will often hibernate for days on end if not otherwise awoken.

name: Infinite Armoredon
description: Even among the armoredon, the possibilities for the future are infinite.

name: Little Red Riding Goat
description: What this goat lacks in size, it makes up for in stubbornness.

name: Bloody Skyscreamer
description: This dinosaur still harbors the rage of its ancestors from the Zandalari Invasion.

name: Twilight Sky Prowler
description: Dubbed the midnight trickster by some, many a couple points to him as the reason their paths crossed in the night.

name: Snowy Riding Goat
description: The Kun-Lai Summit mountain goats are known for climbing even the highest peaks in search of kafa beans and salt licks.

name: Pestilent Necroray
description: When a necroray hatches, spores fly everywhere, making a huge mess.

name: Night Pterrorwing
description: Scholars interpret this creature's awful screeching as "fear me, I am the night!"

name: Fur-endship Fox
description: These magical creatures thrive on love and friendship.

name: Armored Irontusk
description: It is said an elekk never forgets. No wonder it despises the Iron Horde, considering the torment the orcs put the beast through.

name: Cobalt Juggernaut
description: What started as a rideable mining and logging machine devolved quickly into chaos when engineers asked themselves if they could make it any cooler.

name: Fel Iron Juggernaut
description: This war machine was stolen from a timeline in which Garrosh Hellscream joined the Burning Legion. Suffice it to say, there is not much left of that timeline.

name: Jade Pterrordax
description: This favored mount of the Zandalari is a great singer, or so it thinks.

name: Heartseeker Mana Ray
description: Someone once told this mana ray it was adorable. It has been pursuing that positive feeling ever since.

name: Crowd Pummeler 2-30
description: Guaranteed to knock the teeth out from your enemies with a single punch!

name: Evening Sun Dreamsaber
description: These dreamsabers are ferocious in battle, yet lethargic and often found lazily outstretched upon open fields. After soaking in the warmth of daylight, their flame flares that much brighter.

name: Renewed Proto-Drake
description: As the isles awaken, these proto-drakes answer the call to soar the skies alongside mortals.

name: Purple Shado-Pan Riding Tiger
description: "When waking a tiger, use a long stick. Better yet, tell your friend to wake the tiger instead." -Pandaren Proverb

name: Remembered Golden Gryphon
description: They love lions in Stormwind, and the gryphon is half lion. This is why these creatures are an air travel staple throughout the Alliance.

name: Grotto Netherwing Drake
description: After traveling to Outland and back, it's only natural these drakes seek out new skies.

name: Remembered Wind Rider
description: Hundreds of battles across a dozen campaigns have been fought and won on the backs of these honored creatures.

name: Cyan Glowmite
description: Glowmites are well-known in the Ringing Deeps for making surprisingly sturdy mounts. This specimen produces a soft cyan glow that kobolds find especially relaxing.

name: Flourishing Whimsydrake
description: These playful protectors of the Emerald Dream may be larger than their faerie dragon relatives, but they are no less mischievous.

name: Slayer's Felbroken Shrieker
description: You broke it, you bought it.

name: Blue Qiraji War Tank
description: The Qiraji War Tank has only been seen recently during the Call of the Scarab, could this hint at a resurfacing of the deadly creatures?

name: Vicious Dreamtalon
description: This feline beast's preferred prey is the Horde.

name: Shackled Shadow
description: Who would have guessed that a shadow elemental would make for such a comfortable ride?

name: Flourishing Whimsydrake
description: These playful protectors of the Emerald Dream may be larger than their faerie dragon relatives, but they are no less mischievous.

name: August Phoenix
description: The magnificent August Phoenixes are blessed by Chi-Ji to fill the hearts of riders with wonder and hope for the future.

name: Astral Emperor's Serpent
description: After the unburdened Emperor Shaohao gave his final breath to protect his people, a golden serpent descended from the heavens to alight the emperor's spirit to the peaks of Kun-Lai Summit.

name: Sky Surfer
description: An ancient mogu artifact awarded to those who are deeply committed to the skies.

name: Carcinized Zerethsteed
description: The few of these mysterious creatures that remain appear to be impossibly old, almost timeless. Perhaps they were created by the First Ones, because no schematic to synthesize these has yet been discovered.

name: Golden Regal Scarab
description: Plated with gold and socketed with emeralds, this scarab is fit to fly royalty in style.

name: Dusky Waycrest Gryphon
description: Common to the dark forests of Drustvar, these gryphon are silent and swift. Their prowess at operating on their own or as mounts lends them to be used for ambush and shock tactics.

name: Red Wolf
description: Almost none remain in the whole of Azeroth; only the most experienced will have seen one.

name: Sentinel War Wolf
description: Captured in a Sentinel raid, the loyalty of the wolf favors the strongest.

name: Daystorm Windsteed
description: It is said that when lightning strikes the sun, a gleaming beast in red armor would emerge from the heavens. The Daystorm Windsteed has never heard of these legends and has been here the entire time.

name: Vicious Moonbeast
description: Unlike most of its kind, this moonbeast has a taste for Horde blood and an affinity for the color blue.

name: Suntouched Dreamstag
description: The sun's radiant energy nurtures these dreamstags, helping them rapidly reach maturity.

name: Rekindled Dreamstag
description: Ashes of fallen leaves are fertile soil for dreamstags to arise from.

name: Aquamarine Swarmite
description: While it's not exactly common, the representatives of the Severed Threads assure you that swarmites are more than capable of carrying your weight if you choose to ride it.

name: Delver's Dirigible
description: This aircraft will help you delve straight into adventure, wherever it may be!

name: Vicious Moonbeast
description: Unlike most of its kind, this moonbeast has a taste for Alliance blood and an affinity for the color red.

name: Shellack
description: Fed by victory and hardened by glory, this snail is nothing less than a tribute to mastery.

name: Alunira
description: For so long, the very embodiment of the clouds laid trapped atop a mountain of lightning. And at last, I can feel the wind at my back once again.

name: Enchanted Wakener's Runestag
description: Wakener runestags fiercely protect their wildseed groves. When the groves starting to fail, many runestags went berserk.

name: Ginormous Grrloc
description: It's the second biggest murloc you've ever seen!

name: Cryptic Aurelid
description: The Cyphers of the First Ones are beyond any mortal understanding. A curious effect of the language is that, for reasons unknown, some aurelids are drawn to mortals who aspire to unlock its mystery.

name: Shimmermist Runner
description: Mischievous spriggans and the valerunners have a natural enmity. No valerunner would deign to allow a spriggan rider because they can sense their inherent malevolence. This angers the trickster spriggans who take twisted enjoyment in playing cruel pranks on these majestic creatures.

name: Imagiwing
description: There's nothing more beautiful than watching your imagination take flight.

name: Vicious War Croaker
description: These creatures are so enthusiastic when charging into battle that they will croak out something that sounds very much like "FOR THE HORDE!"

name: Soaring Spelltome
description: In the forgotten depths of the Dalaran library, this oversized tome was found flapping madly around the room. Open the pages of this arcane-infused book and hitch a ride to magical adventure.

name: Vicious War Croaker
description: These creatures are so enthusiastic when charging into battle that they will croak out something that sounds very much like "FOR THE ALLIANCE!"

name: Duskflutter Ardenmoth
description: These ardenmoths prefer the dark and damp forests of northwest Ardenweald, where fungal colonies are perpetually blooming.

name: Sanctum Gloomcharger
description: Only the Jailer's most powerful lieutenants are gifted these steeds to stalk the halls of the Tower.

name: Salatrancer
description: While most salamanthers' attention jumps freely from one attraction to the next, this one enjoys long periods of deep observation.

name: Soulbound Gloomcharger
description: Ve'nari has many methods of sneaking around the Maw and disrupting the Jailer's plans, including binding his own minions.

name: Snowfluff Dreamtalon
description: As lighthearted and gentle as the snow, they can bounce from one snowdrift to the next without leaving a print.

name: Keg Leg's Radiant Crocolisk
description: The pirate captain later known as Keg Leg knew the risks when he rode a hungry crocolisk into battle.

name: Fallen Charger
description: The charger's screams echo across the Maw as it continues a never-ending ride across the land, forever looking for escape from the endless torments it has been forced to endure.

name: Swift Zhevra
description: Zhevras are rarely used as mounts in Azeroth due to their stubborn nature and tendency to bite.

name: Stonevault Mechsuit
description: Metal once ruined, restored to life by scrap and song.

name: Polly Roger
description: The scourge of the slightly-northeastern seas, giant parrots like Polly can live for up to 2000 years. What a wonderful curse on your next of kin.

name: Compass Rose
description: Pried from a giant Hearthstone game box.

name: Slatestone Ramolith
description: Earthen ranchers talk often of this creature's resilience and how the rain ricochets off of its lustrous coat.

name: Ivory Goliathus
description: Giant beetles that spend their lives in the darkest tunnels of Khaz Algar.  Though they are deprived even of the faintest glimmer of artificial sunlight, they still thrive.

name: Vengeful Nether Drake
description: The most aggressive nether drakes were awarded those heroes who showed significant prowess and commitment in the gladiatorial arena.

name: Azure Worldchiller
description: In the corners of Azeroth, stories are told of a dreaded dragon who swept a pall of torment over the land. In some versions of this story, his fiery presence brought cataclysmic death and destruction worldwide. In other versions, he is blue.

name: Hand of Nilganihmaht
description: Of all the giants who dared defy the Jailer, Nilganihmaht was the most arrogant. For this transgression, the giant's severed hand was hidden within a veil of torments, and the rings that could summon it back were scattered across the Maw.

name: Silky Shimmermoth
description: The moths of Ardenweald play a vital role in the ecosystem, carrying spores, anima, and pollen from one part of the forest to the other, providing nourishment and variation to the denizens living below.

name: Majestic Azure Peafowl
description: The peafowl is renowned for its stunning colors and plumage.

name: Swift Zhevra
description: Zhevras are rarely used as mounts in Azeroth due to their stubborn nature and tendency to bite.

name: Coldflame Infernal
description: The strange icy flames cause you to sweat and shiver at the same time.

name: Great Brewfest Kodo
description: Coren Direbrew won this prize after drinking a Tauren druid under the table - and the druid was in bear form. It was one of Direbrew's proudest moments.

name: Savage Ebony Battle Turtle
description: The cannons are powered by an unquenchable rage to seek out enemies and bring them to justice. Nothing can outrun a cannon.

name: Palehide Direhorn
description: Pale-skinned direhorns are quite rare, justifying the expense.

name: Vicious White Bonesteed
description: There are few other ways to ride in to battle that feature as many spikes and bones.

name: Fabious
description: He emerges from the water, fins swaying lazily in the breeze, sun-kissed scales glittering. He is... Fabious.

name: Junkheap Drifter
description: When you really want to be noticed... and don't mind strapping yourself to a giant, barely-held-together wheel.

name: Pureheart Courser
description: These coursers have long been known to exist, but only befriend those that have gone to great lengths for friendship.

name: Craghorn Chasm-Leaper
description: These mighty leapers have adapted to island life by learning to catch seagulls swooping through crags and fissures.

name: Bloodgorged Crawg
description: This crawg was left alone to feast on G'huun's corrupted blood and rot. He was so happy.

name: Broken Highland Mustang
description: One of the Arathi horses, taken and broken by the Horde conquerors of Stromgarde.

name: Siesbarg
description: Poor guy.

name: Swift White Steed
description: A veteran of some of the toughest battles fought by the Argent Crusade.

name: Rusty Mechanocrawler
description: The check engine light is always on, it's when it goes off that you should be worried.

name: Black Riding Goat
description: It takes unflagging patience and a gentle touch to train obstinate mountain goats for riding.

name: Silvertip Dredwing
description: Bred by the Revendreth prince, Renathal, these rare dredwing are fiercely loyal and will only let those deemed worthy by the prince himself to interact with them.

name: Bulbous Necroray
description: The necrorays of Maldraxxus prefer to congregate around the enormous decaying mushrooms of the region.

name: Stormwind Skychaser
description: "Give me all the engines you got." - Engineer Cogspinner

name: Ol' Mole Rufus
description: Wiser than words can say and still quick on his feet. He just gets a lil' tired sometimes.

name: Earthen Ordinant's Ramolith
description: Beneath the stone surface beats a heart emboldened by order to set this world free from darkness.

name: Cartel Master's Gearglider
description: Only the richest cartel leaders are able to afford the metals required to craft the Cartel Master's Gearglider.

name: Ascended Skymane
description: Only those that have proven themselves against the combined might of the Ascended will be able to ride this mount.

name: Sundered Zerethsteed
description: Whatever the purpose of these cervids once was, it is long forgotten. Though they are not Dominated, they have been corrupted by the unintended presence of Mawsworn in the sacred realm of Zereth Mortis.

name: Cerulean Ruinstrider
description: Talbuks, native to Argus, have evolved chitinous plates to survive the decades of ceaseless war that ravages the landscape.

name: Scrapforged Mechaspider
description: You built this yourself, you should be proud, even though it's smoky, sparky, and loud.

name: Noble Bruffalon
description: It is a great honor to be trusted with one of the Maruuk's loyal hunting companions. This Bruffalon is reliable and steadfast through any hardship.

name: Vicious White Warsaber
description: If you try to give it a belly scratch, you're asking for trouble.

name: Restoration Deathwalker
description: With the death of the Jailer and the ascension of a new Arbiter, the Shadowlands is returning to its great Purpose. Some deathwalkers recognize the role that mortal heroes have played, and are willing to serve as mounts.

name: Soultwisted Deathwalker
description: A howling vortex of tormented souls, ridden only by those who wish to demonstrate their impressive tolerance for pain and suffering.

name: Winterborn Runestag
description: Winterborn runestags are blessed by the Winter Queen herself. Their runes flare brilliantly when predators are nearby, warning the entire herd.

name: Chittering Animite
description: These exceptionally agile fliers make excellent mounts once they've been trained not to sap every ounce of anima from their rider.

name: Ashenvale Chimaera
description: Ashenvale chimaeras were used frequently by the Kaldorei to decimate structures in battles against the humans, orcs, and undead.

name: Riding Turtle
description: Slow and steady might not always win you the race but it'll get you there... eventually.

name: Eternal Gladiator's Soul Eater
description: This soul eater's gaze unnerves you. Best not meet its eyes for too long.

name: Winged Steed of the Ebon Blade
description: Dead or alive, you're coming with me.

name: Quawks
description: Squawks's older (and somehow louder) brother appears to tolerate your presence. For now. You should probably track down some crackers while you still can.

name: Ferocious Jawcrawler
description: This particularly large jawcrawler is the perfect size to make a mount... just keep your hands and feet clear of its mouth.

name: Obsidian Worldbreaker
description: "I have had many names throughout history, all of them spoken with dread: Neltharion, Xaxas, and many more. Yet you shall know me best as Deathwing, for so I am! I am the bane of life, the darkness within history, the lord of death, the master of destruction. And I tell you now, and so it is true, that this world is mine!" - Neltharion, the Earth-Warder

name: Voracious Gorger
description: The devourers are presumed to have their origins in the In-Between, a space between the lands of the Shadowlands that few have explored.

name: Wastewander Skyterror
description: Doubting a Wastewander Skyterror's capabilities is a quick way to find yourself missing a limb.

name: Surf Jelly
description: The time between being stung and being enveloped and devoured is short enough to consider not swimming in the Great Sea.

name: Waste Marauder
description: Larger than most of its kin, this vulture has shown sick and strong beasts alike why they need to fear the skies.

name: Bone-White Primal Raptor
description: "They are lethal at eight months, very lethal." -Hemet Nesingwary Jr.

name: Swift Albino Raptor
description: The Witherbark warrior Beastrider Kama once cut bloody swathes of terror across the Arathi Highlands astride such a monster.

name: Fiery Hearthsteed
description: These flying creatures thunder unseen across the heavens. How fortunate that this one has shown itself to you!

name: Twilight Harbinger
description: Whatever dark magic once compelled the Twilight Harbinger is now broken... or is it?

name: Gray Elekk
description: Patient and strong, the Elekk exemplify the Draenei attitude towards the hardships of life.

name: Green Dragon Turtle
description: Cherished for their heavy carrying capacity and steady gait, these stalwart beasts are the mount of choice for most native Pandaren.

name: Vibrant Mana Ray
description: Some of the natural wildlife of Argus, like the mana ray, has survived and adapted to life on the shattered world.

name: Gray Wolf
description: This breed of wolf prefers hunting in the fog, relying on its smoky hide to camouflage it from unsuspecting prey.

name: Emerald Raptor
description: Bred from the fiercest stock anywhere and guaranteed not to bite (much).

name: Black Stallion
description: Rumored to be favored by SI:7 for night missions due to its dark coat.

name: Brown Ram
description: Male rams will often smash their thick skulls against each other for hours to impress a female. In that way, they're very similar to dwarves.

name: Experiment 12-B
description: Some believe Experiment 12-B is the result of a covert SI-7 initiative, others consider it the outcome of embyronic tinkering by goblin scientists. No matter the case, this much is certain: given its strength, speed and agility, Experiment 12-B was a success!

name: Pinto
description: Its calm temperament makes it ideal to train young children in horseback riding.

name: Lil' Donkey
description: Likely stolen from Newstead in the Arathi Highlands, this stalwart little donkey was destined to be eaten by kobolds.

name: Frostshard Infernal
description: These icy minions come from an unknown plane far from this one.

name: Runebound Firelord
description: By fire be purged the obstacles in your path!

name: White Stallion
description: The powerful and unyielding white stallion features heavily in the myths of ancient human tribes.

name: Skullripper
description: She's a clever girl.

name: Rampaging Mauler
description: One would think controlling a rampaging mount would be difficult, but if you can learn to control the direction of the rampage it can be quite useful.

name: Warlord's Deathwheel
description: Often referred to as the "Goblin Lawn Mower", this growling behemoth treats enemies like they are made of grass... ready to be mown down.
